abstract: High number of people who hold library card at San Jose Public Library in California, which serves largely low-income, immigrant patrons, are barred from using library due to unpaid fees for late or lost books; fee system, implemented to help struggling library pay for books and services, has in effect barred neediest patrons from system, leading to calls to waive or reduce fees.
lead_paragraph: The library, owed $6.8 million in fees for overdue and lost items, prohibits children who can’t pay but need the library the most from borrowing materials or using its computers.

headline.main: In San Jose, Poor Find Doors to Library Closed
headline.print_headline: In San Jose, Poor Find Doors to Library Closed

snippet: The library, owed $6.8 million in fees for overdue and lost items, prohibits children who can’t pay but need the library the most from borrowing materials or using its computers.
